Welcome

ccstan99's learning journal

After years of homeschooling my kids, instilling a lifelong love of learning, it’s finally my turn! I’ve been immersed in all the exciting developments in Artificial Intelligence (AI), particularly Natural Language Processing (NLP). Before all that, I did freelance work with interactive programming and design. I originally studied Computational Linguistics at UCLA then earned a MS Computer Science in Human Computer Interaction (HCI) at Stanford.

Readings

  • AI/NLP Courses & Journals - Particularly helpful resources for me
  • Goodreads Bookshelf - Exploring all sorts of rabbit holes

Presentations

The lovely people at DataCircles have provided a supportive environment to learn and share about AI & ML. Here’s slides from my recent presentations:

  • What is NLP?
  • What are Transformers?
  • AGI Safety
  • AI Gridworlds
  • Winograd Schema Challenge
  • Sentence-BERT
  • Classification Metrics
  • Training Models
  • Dimensionality Reduction

Projects

The AGI Alignment ecosystem has interesting projects I’ve been helping with:

  • Stampy - AGI Safety & Alignment FAQ headed by Rob Miles. I worked on the front-end UI/UX, logo redesign, and did some light coding: implemented in-browser semantic search & identified duplicate questions using NLP, created web workers to avoid GUI blocking issues, and used GitHub Actions to automate embeddings generation & website deployment.

Mentoring

For students interested in STEM, here’s some wonderful organizations:

  • AI4ALL - As a mentor for summer portfolio projects, I put together some quick video overviews and a Colab Notebook to get students started with NLP classification tasks, fine-tuning Transformer models on Hugging Face.
  • Technovation Challenge - I’ve been a judge advisor the last few years, but I began by mentoring a team to create a mobile app social good. Their app Rooting for You was the North America Regional Winner in 2020!
